Course Description: This is an introductory course to electrodynamics (along with electrostatics and magnetostatics). This course will serve as a foundational course for students interested in working in RF and micro-wave, millimeter wave and optical systems.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Students are able to execute vector calculus operations (gradient, divergence, curl, line, surface and volume integrals) in Cartesian and curvilinear coordinates
Course Outcomes.CO2: Students are able to use Coulomb's law, Gauss's law and Poisson's equation to solve for electric field, flux density and potentials for point, line, surface and volume charge distributions
Course Outcomes.CO3: Students are able to use Biot Savart's law and Ampere's law to solve for magnetic field and flux density
Course Outcomes.CO4: Students are able to analyze Maxwell's equations of time- harmonic fields to describe electromagnetic wave propagation in different media and across boundaries
Course Outcomes.CO5: Students are able to analyze electromagnetic wave propagation through simple transmission lines

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Vector Analysis - Vector algebra, differential calculus, integral calculus, curvilinear coordinates
Electrostatics - Coulombs law, electric field, Gauss's law, electric potential, energy and potential, electric fields in matter, Poisson's and Laplace's equations
Magnetostatics - Biot-Savart's law, magnetic field, Ampere's law, magnetic fields in matter
Electrodynamics - electromotive force, electromagnetic induction, Maxwell's equations
